Questions: What should I do if my study permit expires while I’m still in Canada?
Answers: If your study permit expires while you are still in Canada, you must apply for an extension before it expires. If your permit has already expired, you may be able to restore your status within 90 days of expiry by applying to extend your study permit. You must also continue to meet the conditions of your study permit, including being enrolled at a designated learning institution.

Questions: Can I study part-time with a study permit?
Answers: Generally, you need to be a full-time student to maintain your study permit. However, there are exceptions where part-time study is allowed, such as during your final semester or if you need to take a break due to illness or other extenuating circumstances. Make sure to check your study permit conditions for specific details.

Questions: Can I switch from a visitor visa to a study permit while in Canada?
Answers: Yes, you can apply to change your status from a visitor visa to a study permit while in Canada, provided that you meet the eligibility criteria. You must have a letter of acceptance from a designated learning institution and apply for the study permit before your visitor status expires.

Questions: Can I work while studying in Canada with a study permit?
Answers: Yes, if your study permit allows, you can work part-time (up to 20 hours per week) during regular academic sessions and full-time during scheduled breaks, such as summer or winter holidays. You must ensure that your study permit explicitly allows you to work off-campus or on-campus.

Questions: Can I apply for a work permit if I am finishing my studies in Canada?
Answers: You can apply for a post-graduation work permit (PGWP) if you meet the eligibility criteria after completing your study program. Ensure you apply for the PGWP before your study permit expires to continue working in Canada.

Questions: Can I work for any employer during my co-op program?
Answers: During your co-op program, your work permit may limit you to working for a specific employer. If your permit includes a condition like 'not authorized to work for any employer other than stated,' it means you can only work for employers approved by your school's co-op program.

Questions: How can I apply for a co-op work permit as an international student?
Answers: To apply for a co-op work permit, you must prove that the work experience is an essential component of your study program. Acceptable proof may include a letter from your school or a copy of the curriculum showing that the co-op or internship is mandatory.

Questions: Is it possible to work in Canada during my semester breaks?
Answers: Yes, you can work full-time during scheduled breaks, such as summer holidays or spring break, as long as your study permit remains valid and you meet all the required criteria for off-campus or on-campus work.
